title: Controlling pensioner used tracking devices to stalk former partner
text:
Rodney Coffin has been jailed for a stalking campaign

A jilted former Royal Yachtsman was arrested for stalking his ex-girlfriend after following her straight to a police station.

Rodney Coffin, 72, had hidden two tracking devices on Mandy Pollyn’s car which he used to keep watch of her every move.

Suspecting her old flame was stalking her, Ms Pollyn went to report him to the police and the possessive pensioner was promptly arrested outside the station by officers.

Coffin, a Royal Navy petty officer who served on HMY Britannia under the Queen, has been jailed for two years after pleading guilty to stalking.

Bournemouth Crown Court heard how he had been unable to accept his two year relationship with Ms Pollyn had come to an end in 2016.

He set up a fake profile on a dating website just to initiate contact with his 55 year old former partner.

While he was initially issued with a restraining order this was lifted when the pair briefly rekindled their romance in 2017.

However when they split for good Ms Pollyn was inundated with emails and text messages from Coffin declaring his love for her.

In a bid to keep watch over her every move the spurned lover attached two tracking devices to the wheel arches of her car.

Ms Pollyn did find one of the trackers after a few days but the second device went undetected allowing Coffin to pinpoint her whereabouts.

Between August 1 and 9 this year Coffin received 440 text updates from the tracker and was spotted by his victim on a number of occasions.

In an attempt to escape his sinister gaze Ms Pollyn moved into a hotel as she no longer felt safe in her own home.

But when she awoke to find Coffin waiting outside the hotel she drove straight to Poole police station where the pensioner was arrested.

Jane Rowley, prosecuting, said: ‘The victim was in a relationship with the defendant for two years but left him as he was possessive and controlling.

‘He has a previous conviction for stalking the same victim which makes this a higher culpability case. There was also a high element of planning to his behaviour.’

In a victim impact statement read at court Ms Pollyn described the devastating toll Coffin’s campaign of control had on her life.

She said: ‘It has been terrible. Everybody believed him and not me. I am truth itself – you could not meet anyone more truthful than me.

‘I am very strong and very determined that justice will be on my side and he will be served with what he deserves for ruining my life.

‘I want him totally away from me forever.’

As well as a two year jail sentence Coffin was also slapped with a restraining order preventing him from having any contact with his victim.
description: A jilted former Royal Yachtsman was arrested for stalking his ex-girlfriend after following her straight to a police station.
